meanings.definition: Resembling a claw in shape or function.
meanings.sent1: The tree had clawlike branches reaching out in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The robot's clawlike hands were perfect for picking up small objects.
meanings.sent3: The clawlike shadows of the branches danced on the wall in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: Her clawlike nails seemed to dig into the truth, revealing hidden secrets.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a clawlike gate that creaked in the wind, adding to its eerie charm.

meanings.definition: Having characteristics similar to a claw.
meanings.sent1: The dinosaur's clawlike teeth were sharp and menacing.
meanings.sent2: The cat's paw had a clawlike shape, ready to catch its prey.
meanings.sent3: The clawlike grip of the vice made it easy to tighten bolts securely.
meanings.sent4: His clawlike determination to succeed drove him to work hard every day.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered in a clawlike formation, foretelling a heavy downpour.
